alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Hyde; Martin; Pitt; Washington (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 26 at 6:28PM EDT until April 26 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Newport has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Washington County in eastern North Carolina... Eastern Pitt County in eastern North Carolina... Northwestern Hyde County in eastern North Carolina... Southeastern Martin County in eastern North Carolina... Beaufort County in eastern North Carolina... * Until 730 PM EDT. * At 626 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Williamston to near Kinston, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Greenville, Washington, Winterville, Williamston, Plymouth, River Road, Stokes, Belhaven, Sladesville, Ransomville, Ponzer, Scranton, Pinetown, Pungo, Blounts Creek, Pamlico Beach, House, Shelmerdine, Pactolus and Black Jack. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. Please send your reports of hail and/or wind damage, including trees or large limbs downed, by calling the National Weather Service office in Newport at 1-800-889-6889.
